           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Search Google Scholar for Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_20" id="content10101170">
          <div id="boxatt10101170" class="boxatt">
           <label for="searchText10101170">
            <img alt="Google Scholar Logo" src="http://lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/google_scholar.jpg" />
           </label>
           <br />
           <input type="text" value="" id="searchText10101170" class="google_search_box" title="Google scholar search" />
           <br />
           <input type="button" onclick="var queryString = document.getElementById('searchText10101170').value;queryString = queryString.replace(/\\+/g, '+');var url = 'http://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=' + queryString;window.open(url,'GScholar');" value="Search" />
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>

     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:520px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox18321432">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18321432">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18321432">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Stephanie Coontz (September 28)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321432">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Stephanie Coontz
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "The American Family.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Life
            </em>
            22.12 (1999): 79-82. Available
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=2377451&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             The Way We Never Were: American Families and the Nostalgia Trip
            </em>
            . New York, NY: BasicBooks, 1992. Available in Trexler Library
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/search%7ES0/?searchtype=t&amp;searcharg=way+we+never+were&amp;SORT=D&amp;extended=0&amp;SUBMIT=Search&amp;searchlimits=&amp;searchorigarg=tway+we+never+were">
             call # 516.204 L788g
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            "Review: Complicating the Contested Terrain of Work/Family Intersections. &rdquo;
            <em>
             Signs
            </em>
            22.2 (1997) : 440-452. Available
            <a href="http://0-www.jstor.org.library.muhlenberg.edu/stable/3175284">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Why American Families Need the Census."
            <em>
             Annals of the American Academy of Political &amp; Social Science
            </em>
            631.(2010): 141-149. Available
            <a href="http://0-ann.sagepub.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/content/631/1/141.abstract">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Stephanie Coontz, plus Interviews
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             About Stephanie Coontz
            </em>
            . 2005. Web. 11 July, 2011. Available
            <a href="http://www.stephaniecoontz.com/about.htm">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Dykstra, Katherine. &ldquo;Parts and Partial [ Interview with Stephanie Coontz about the American Family].&rdquo;
            <em>
             Guernica
            </em>
            . 1 Sept 2011. Web. 2 Sept 2011. Available
            <a href="http://www.guernicamag.com/interviews/3023/stephanie_coontz_interview_9_1_11/">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Nostalgia and the Concept of the Family
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Cassuto, Leonard. &ldquo;The Real-Life Myth of the American Family [review of
            <em>
             The Way We Never Were
            </em>
            ].&rdquo;
            <em>
             American Literary History
            </em>
            20.3 (2008): 487-496. Available
            <a href="http://0-muse.jhu.edu.library.muhlenberg.edu/journals/american_literary_history/v020/20.3.levine.pdf">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Cunningham, Mick. "Changing Attitudes toward the Male Breadwinner, Female Homemaker Family Model: Influences of Women's Employment and Education over the Lifecourse."
            <em>
             Social Forces
            </em>
            87.1 (2008): 299-323. Available
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=ahl&amp;AN=35369778&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Lundberg, Shelly, and Robert A Pollak. "The American Family and Family Economics."
            <em>
             Journal of Economic Perspectives
            </em>
            21.2 (2007): 3-26. Available
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=ahl&amp;AN=25264886&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Skolnick, Arlene S.
            <em>
             Embattled Paradise: The American Family in an Age of Uncertainty
            </em>
            . New York: Basic Books, 1991. Available in Trexler Library
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/search%7ES0?/dFamily+--+United+States+--+History+--+20th+centur/dfamily+united+states+history+++20th+century/-3,-1,0,B/frameset&amp;FF=dfamily+united+states+history+++20th+century&amp;2,,6">
             call # 306.850973 S628e
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt18321432" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18321498">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18321498">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18321498">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Jonah Lehrer (October 5)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321498">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Jonah Lehrer
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             How We Decide
            </em>
            . Boston: Houghton Mifflin, 2009. Available at Trexler Library, call number
            <strong>
             <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/search%7ES0?/thow+we+decide/thow+we+decide/1,3,4,B/frameset&amp;FF=thow+we+decide&amp;1,1,">
              153.83 L524h.
             </a>
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Proust Was a Neuroscientist
            </em>
            . Boston: Houghton Mifflin, 2007. Available at Trexler Library, call number
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/search/?searchtype=t&amp;searcharg=proust+was+a+neuroscientist&amp;SORT=D&amp;search=Search">
             700.105 L524p
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "The Truth Wears Off."
            <em>
             New Yorker
            </em>
            86.40 (2010): 52-57. Available
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=55695642&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Think Better: Tips from a Savant."
            <em>
             Scientific American Mind
            </em>
            20.2 (2009): 61-63. Available
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=37837592&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Unlocking the Mysteries of the Artistic Mind."
            <em>
             Psychology Today
            </em>
            42, no. 4 (July 2009): 72-77. Available
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=42749210&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Jonah Lehrer
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             Jonah Lehrer
            </em>
            . n.d. Web. 12 July 2011. Available
            <a href="http://www.jonahlehrer.com/about">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about the Science of Memory
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Boyer, Pascal, and James V. Wertsch, eds.
           <em>
            Memory in Mind and Culture
           </em>
           . New York: Cambridge University Press, 2009. Available at Trexler Library, call number
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/search%7ES0?/dMemory+--+Social+aspects/dmemory+social+aspects/-3,-1,0,B/frameset&amp;FF=dmemory+social+aspects&amp;10,,17">
            153.12 M533i.
           </a>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Brainerd, Charles J.
           <em>
            The Science of False Memory
           </em>
           . New York: Oxford University Press, 2005. Available at Trexler Library, call number &nbsp;
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/search%7ES0?/Xd%3A%28memory%29&amp;Da=2003&amp;Db=&amp;SORT=D/Xd%3A%28memory%29&amp;Da=2003&amp;Db=&amp;SORT=D&amp;SUBKEY=d%3A%28memory%29/51,63,63,B/frameset&amp;FF=Xd%3A%28memory%29&amp;Da=2003&amp;Db=&amp;SORT=D&amp;52,52,">
            616.89 B814s.
           </a>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Fahey, John A., and Gilberto De Los Santos. &ldquo;Memory Improvement and Research Related to the Science of Memory.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Education
           </em>
           123.2 (2002) : 380+. Available
           <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=9134841&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Glaskin, Katie. &ldquo;Dreams, Memory, and the Ancestors: Creativity, Culture, and the Science of Sleep.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Journal of the Royal Anthropological Institute
           </em>
           17.1 (2011) : 44-62. Available
           <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=57828796&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Loftus, Elizabeth. &ldquo;Science and Society: Our Changeable Memories: Legal and Practical Implications.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Nature Reviews Neuroscience
           </em>
           4.3 (2003) : 231+. Available
           <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=9220413&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Quas, Jodi A., et al, eds.
           <em>
            Emotion and Memory in Development: Biological, Cognitive,and Social Considerations
           </em>
           . Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2009. Print. Available at Trexler Library, call number (&nbsp;
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/search%7ES0?/c155.41312+E54a/c155.41312+e54a/-3,-1,,E/browse">
            155.41312 E54a
           </a>
           ).
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt18321498" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18321527">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18321527">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18321527">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           National Memorials and Museums (October 15)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321527">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Memorials and Museums as National Memory
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Ater, Ren&eacute;e. "Slavery and Its Memory in Public Monuments."
            <em>
             American Art
            </em>
            24.1 (2010): 20-23. Available
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=ahl&amp;AN=49036635&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Barnes, John. "The Struggle to Control the Past: Commemoration, Memory, and the Bear River Massacre of 1863."
            <em>
             Public Historian
            </em>
            30.1 (2008): 81-104. Available
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=ahl&amp;AN=31718189&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Dupr&eacute;, Judith.
            <em>
             Monuments: America's history in art and memory.
            </em>
            New York: Random House, 2007. Available at Trexler Library, call number:
            <strong>
             <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/search%7ES0?/tmonuments/tmonuments/1,20,20,B/frameset&amp;FF=tmonuments+americas+history+in+art+and+memory&amp;1,1,">
              973 D942m
             </a>
            </strong>
            .
           </p>

            <em>
             Journal of Southern History
            </em>
            77.1 (2011): 91-120. Available
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=ahl&amp;AN=57671213&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>

            Shackel, Paul, ed.
            <em>

            </em>
            . Gainesville: University Press of Florida, 2001. Available at Trexler Library, call number

             973 S524m.
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>

            </em>

          <h2>
           Jeffrey Olick and Philip Gourevitch (October 19)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321535">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Jeffrey Olick
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>

            </em>
            . New York: Routledge, 2007. Available at Trexler Library, call number:

          <h2>

          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Friedrich St. Florian (November 15)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321574">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Friedrich St. Florian
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             Friedrich St. Florian Architects
            </em>
            . Web. 23 Aug 2011. Available
            <a href="http://www.fstflorian.com/">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Friedrich St. Florian
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Friedrich St. Florian.&rdquo;
            <em>
             David Winton Bell Gallery, Brown University
            </em>
            . May 2006. Web. 23 July 2011. Available
            <a href="http://www.brown.edu/Facilities/David_Winton_Bell_Gallery/Florian.html">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about the Role of Architecture in Public Memory and History
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           National Coalition to Save Our Mall.
           <em>
            The World War II Memorial Defaces a National Treasure
           </em>
           . Web. 26 Aug 2011. Available
           <a href="http://www.savethemall.org/wwii/index.html">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Pickford, Henry W. &ldquo;Conflict and Commemoration: Two Berlin Memorials.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Modernism/Modernity
           </em>
           12.1 (2005): 133-173. Available
           <a href="http://0-muse.jhu.edu.library.muhlenberg.edu/journals/modernism-modernity/v012/12.1pickford.html">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Shackel, Paul A. &ldquo;Public memory and the search for power in American historical archaeology.&rdquo; American Anthropologist 103.3 (2001): 655-670. Available
           <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=5949748&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt18321574" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentright" style="width:209px;float:left; padding-right:0px;">
